title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers, now with the Raiders, looks forward to playing against his former team, the Patriots, in Foxborough.
Raiders HC Pete Carroll praises Patriots' physical running game and highlights QB Drake Maye's running ability as a threat.
Raiders offensive and defensive staff commend Patriots' formidable front seven, noting the challenge posed by players like Milton Williams.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown streamed a tour of Boston with YouTuber IShowSpeed, including a playful reenactment of the Boston Tea Party.
Brown and IShowSpeed engaged in various activities, including Muay Thai and a footrace in Downtown Crossing.
Brown humorously contested IShowSpeed's race victory, suggesting a name change due to a hamstring injury.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, the Patriots' rookie left tackle, will debut against the Raiders on Sunday.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's run blocking and competitiveness, despite concerns about his arm length.
Campbell earned high preseason grades for both pass and run blocking from Pro Football Focus.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: UNC coach Bill Belichick banned Patriots scouts from attending the school's football practices and games.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged Belichick's decision and said they will find alternate ways to scout UNC players.
Belichick's UNC debut ended with a 48-14 loss to TCU, marking his first college game after an NFL career.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student claims she was secretly filmed in a unisex shower, suing the school for negligence.
The woman, known as Jane Doe, alleges URI defamed her and failed to notify students about the incident or enhance safety.
Suspect James Paquette, identified by the victim, faces a state-level voyeurism charge; URI declines to comment on the lawsuit.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez is out for the Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a lingering hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for Sunday’s game after being limited in practice with an ankle injury.
The Patriots' secondary will see changes with Alex Austin, Marcus Jones, and Carlton Davis stepping up in Gonzalez's absence.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is recovering well from an Achilles injury, according to Celtics teammate Jordan Walsh.
No definitive timeline for Tatum's return; he has been walking without a boot for over a month.
Celtics' roster depth offers opportunities for players to step up amid Tatum's uncertain recovery timeline.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Raiders start new era with Pete Carroll as head coach and Geno Smith as quarterback.
Tom Brady, now a minority owner of the Raiders, will miss the game due to broadcasting duties.
Las Vegas seeks first Foxborough win since 1994 as they visit the Patriots on Sunday.

title: What does it mean that TreVeyon Henderson is listed 3rd on the Patriots’ depth chart?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Rookie TreVeyon Henderson is listed as RB3 on the Patriots' depth chart, following Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson.
Henderson showed promise in preseason with a 100-yard kick return and an eight-yard touchdown rush.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel plans to continue using a running back committee with Stevenson, Gibson, and Henderson.

title: Here’s what fantasy football experts are saying about Patriots players in Week 1
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Experts predict quarterback Drake Maye could excel in Week 1 due to the Raiders' middling pass defense.
Running back Rhamondre Stevenson is expected to lead the Patriots in carries, despite rookie TreVeyon Henderson's preseason performances.
Stefon Diggs is set to play in Week 1 after recovering from a torn ACL, potentially boosting the Patriots' overall offense.
